metadata.title: CVE-2015-8778 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service(application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via the sizeargument to the __hcreate_r function, which triggers out-of-boundsheap-memory access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8778` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu1
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu1').
